result.execSummary:
The defendant Oscar V. Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Oscar V. Hernandez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Oscar V. Hernandez was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $1,200.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  212 - Parties have reviewed PSI. Sentence recommendations.  Defendant is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision.  DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but (is) elligible for the Substance Abuse Program. DL suspended for 36 months. Ignition interlock ordered. Intox assessment ordered. Court orders a $1200 fine plus costs. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court costs ordered - all fines and costs due over term of ES. $140 prosecution costs ordered - order signed this day. Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Fr: Rosa Viesca
from WCS. Program requirements satisfied.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  943 - ST requests PSI - DE would like to proceed with sentencing this day. Court will take plea and allow preparation of PSI. DE enters plea of guilty to Ct1 - found guilty by the Court. Remaining counts dismissed outright. PSI ordered. Bond revoked. DE taken into custody. Certified copy of minutes given to deputy.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
